name: pungi
definition: The pungi is a wind instrument played by snake charmers in India and Pakistan.
description:
The instrument consists of a mouth blown air reservoir which channels air into two reedpipes.

It is traditionally made from a dried bottle gourd. Often, the neck of the gourd is carved for aesthetic reasons. The pungi is typically 30 to 60 centimeters long.

On the other end, two reed or bamboo pipes are connected. One of the pipes has 5 - 9 holes and is used to play the melody; the other pipe is for drone.

The pungi is played with no pauses, with the player employing circular breathing.

The pungi was originally developed as an Indian folk music instrument and is still important for religious purposes and music in India.

It is also played by snake charmers in street performances.

The pungi is believed to be one of the many ways in which one can communicate with the gods through devotional genres.

featured.caption: Snake charming is the practice of appearing to hypnotize a snake, often a cobra, by playing and waving around a pungi.

related.definition: The bansuri is a transverse flute from a single hollow shaft of bamboo with six or seven finger holes.
The duduk is an ancient double-reed woodwind flute made of apricot wood. It is indigenous to Armenia.
A wooden Japanese  end-blown flute with four holes in front and one at the back.
The shehnai is a musical instrument similar to the oboe. It is made out of wood, with a double reed at one end and a flared bell at the other end.
